Dialogue:
EK: Good evening!  
CN: Good evening! How can I assist you tonight?  
EK: Do you have any part-time job experience?  
CN: Yes, in places like restaurants and Uniqlo.  
EK: Uniqlo! I really like that place!  
CN: It was challenging, so I quit soon after starting.  
EK: Was it because you had to keep moving?  
CN: Yes, we couldn't walk slowly in front of customers.  
EK: Why did they have that rule?  
CN: To ensure efficient customer service.  
EK: I see. That makes sense.  
CN: It's meant to keep the service quick and the store tidy.  
EK: Though it makes it hard to talk to staff when they're rushing around.  
CN: True. A balance might be better.  
EK: I had a similar experience once.  
CN: Are there other rules like that which made it popular?  
EK: I worked at a moving company where we had to run while working.  
CN: That sounds exhausting!  
EK: It felt like training, though.  
CN: Did it affect your physical fitness?  
EK: Not much since I did strength training, but it helped.  
CN: Your muscles appreciated the effort?  
EK: In a way, yes.  
CN: That's interesting.  
EK: The muscle pain was intense but a nice memory.  
CN: It's fascinating how work preferences vary.  
EK: Exercise releases endorphins. What part-time job would you like to try?  
CN: I'd love to work at an art museum.  
EK: That sounds wonderful, being around art you love.  
CN: Indeed, enjoying work makes all the difference.

EK: Hello!  
DK: Hello! How can I assist you today?  
EK: Are you off today?  
DK: Yes, I'm relaxing and doing laundry.  
EK: A relaxing weekend sounds nice. Do you go out often?  
DK: No, especially not since COVID-19 began.  
EK: I tend to go out more.  
DK: Where do you usually go on your days off?  
EK: I like to shop leisurely.  
DK: I prefer visiting electronics stores and home centers on weekdays.  
EK: I also enjoy electronics stores without a specific purpose.  
DK: Discovering new items is interesting. I avoid impulse buying.  
EK: Have you bought any electronics recently?  
DK: I replaced a fluorescent light with an LED one last year.  
EK: Those are very bright. We did the same recently.  
DK: Yes, it's remote-controlled and uses half the power.  
EK: Modern electronics are quite convenient.  
DK: Visiting electronics stores helps in making informed choices.  
EK: Even smartphone charging cables come in many varieties.  
DK: Yes, it's quite overwhelming, even at the 100 yen shop.  
EK: I visited a 100 yen shop recently and was surprised by the changes.  
DK: Yes, there are more products priced at 200 yen or 300 yen now.  
EK: It used to feel cheap, but now it’s the opposite.  
DK: Online reviews help popularize cost-effective products.  
EK: That makes a difference.  
DK: Articles and videos on 100-yen shop items are popular.  
EK: I often check YouTube for reviews before buying.  
DK: I do the same; product reviews are helpful.  
EK: Functional products are important for long-term use.  
DK: Absolutely. I repurchase good products. Thank you for the chat.

EK: Hello!
DK: Hello!
EK: Nice to meet you! Is there anything you've been into lately?
DK: I watch soccer through streaming.
EK: I see! Do you play as well?
DK: No, I just watch. I like other sports too.
EK: Like what?
DK: Curling.
EK: You like team-based games.
DK: Yes. Curling is interesting on TV.
EK: Because of different camera angles?
DK: Yes, and players wear microphones.
EK: That's interesting.
DK: It’s interesting to hear their thoughts. Do you do any sports recently?
EK: I train at the gym.
DK: What’s your routine?
EK: I focus on functional training.
DK: How so?
EK: More reps, less weight, faster pace.
DK: Sounds intense.
EK: I also do a lot of aerobic exercise.
DK: How much weight have you lost?
EK: About 10 kilograms.
DK: In how long?
EK: Half a year.
DK: That’s healthy.
EK: I prefer burning calories through exercise.
DK: Maintaining it must be hard.
EK: Consistency is key, without too much stress.
DK: Got it. I should exercise more. Thank you.

EK: Hello!
DQ: Hello! How can I assist you today?
EK: Did you go anywhere this summer?
DQ: I visited my parents' house and the nearby river.
EK: Is it a river? Do you swim in it?
DQ: The children were playing there, but the water was quite cold.
EK: Rivers are cold, aren't they? Is this a mountain stream?
DQ: No, it was U-shaped and slow, not a mountain stream.
EK: The water looks clean, it must be a nice place.
DQ: Yes, I also brought my dog along and relaxed by the river.
EK: You have a dog! By the way, what breed is it?
DQ: I have two shepherds, a German Shepherd and a Belgian Shepherd.
EK: Isn't it big?
DQ: Yes, one is 33kg and the other is 23kg.
EK: Oh! That's quite heavy!
DQ: Yes, but they are very cute despite their size.
EK: I love dogs too! I don't have one, but I've always wanted one someday!
DQ: If you were to have a pet, do you have any preferences?
EK: I'd like a Shiba Inu.
DQ: Shiba Inus are very cute, and there are smaller ones like Mameshiba!
EK: It's cute, isn't it? The fact that I am often away from home is a drawback.
DQ: It might be tough for your pet if you are frequently away.
EK: That's right. It's easy to start keeping a pet.
DQ: Certainly. I haven't been able to go out much either... just for shopping.
EK: That happens, doesn't it? A large dog, huh. Your home must be lively!
DQ: It's lively! By the way, we also have one cat.
EK: Oh! It's just like the Mutsugoro Kingdom! That's nice.
DQ: The children love animals too, and it feels like a little pet therapy.
EK: Just being at home with pets makes me happy.
DQ: It's a bit challenging for middle and high school students, but I leave it to my pets to keep the home lively.

EK: Hello!
DQ: Hello!
EK: What have you been up to?
DQ: I've been reading in my free time.
EK: What kind of books do you read?
DQ: I read light novels with my children and enjoy stories with swordsmen. Currently, I'm reading "Hakkenden."
EK: Your child reads too? I also read novels sometimes.
DQ: What kind do you like?
EK: I enjoy works by Keigo Higashino.
DQ: I like those as well.
EK: Do you read quickly once you start?
DQ: Yes.
EK: I wasn't a big reader, but I found it interesting once I started.
DQ: It's engaging. I borrowed the latest volume of the Kaga series from the library.
EK: That sounds interesting. Any recommendations?
DQ: I like "The Guardian of the Camphor Tree."
EK: I haven't read that.
DQ: It's minor but good for children.
EK: The title sounds intriguing.
DQ: It's unrealistic but touches on modern issues. I recommend it.
EK: I'll buy it next time.
DQ: Sure. We usually use the library, but there's a wait.
EK: I like having physical books, so I buy them.
DQ: Understood. We're running out of space.
EK: When you have too many books, that happens. What about e-books?
DQ: My family uses them, but I can't recall the name.
EK: Convenient, but I prefer physical copies.
DQ: I prefer paper too.
EK: Turning pages and the smell are part of the experience.
DQ: I agree. Kids read on phones, but I prefer paper.

EK: Hello!
DQ: Hello!
EK: Do you drink alcohol?
DQ: Yes, I enjoy beer.
EK: Me too. Have you noticed more people seem unable to drink alcohol nowadays?
DQ: Yes, non-alcoholic beverages are popular.
EK: The recent ones are quite tasty.
DQ: I haven't developed a liking for them.
EK: I prefer juice if it's non-alcoholic.
DQ: Lemon-flavored sparkling water is more refreshing.
EK: What’s your favorite beer brand?
DQ: Premium Malts or Ebisu.
EK: Great choices. We have similar tastes.
DQ: If I'm going to drink, I want it to be good.
EK: I try various kinds but return to my favorites.
DQ: Draft beer in the right setting is always enjoyable.
EK: There are more places offering craft beer now.
DQ: True, but the price can be high.
EK: It's always a gamble with unknown brands.
DQ: Belgian or dark beers are fine with me.
EK: I'd love to visit Belgium for their beer culture.
DQ: I'd like to try white beer there.
EK: Yeast beer must taste different locally.
DQ: Do you think it's tasty at room temperature?
EK: I'd prefer it chilled.
DQ: I like when the glass is chilled.
EK: I lived in Germany; it was great for beer.
DQ: I stayed in Germany; the beer was good.
EK: We had such enjoyable times there!
DQ: Thank you for the conversation.

EK: Hi there! How can I help you today?
BO: Good evening! How can I assist you?
EK: Do you have any hobbies or interests you're exploring recently?
BO: I've started fishing. It’s quite relaxing.
EK: Sea fishing or another kind?
BO: River fishing. It's very peaceful. Do you have a favorite spot?
EK: Do you use lures or other bait?
BO: Both lures and insects.
EK: Have you tried fly fishing?
BO: Not yet. It seems challenging.
EK: Fishing techniques must be interesting to learn. Have you considered trying different methods?
BO: They are. It keeps it exciting. I'm always open to new methods.
EK: Can beginners start easily?
BO: With patience, yes. Any new hobbies for you?
EK: I’m getting into camping. It's been exciting to prepare!
BO: Camping is great for nature.
EK: Have you camped recently?
BO: Used to go often. Great times! Any good spots you’re planning to visit?
EK: I bought a tent and I'm ready to go soon. Any advice on good spots?
BO: That sounds great! Lake Kawaguchi is nice.
EK: Camping by a lake sounds perfect, and you can fish too.
BO: I'll consider it for my next trip.
EK: There are so many great spots; it’s hard to choose! Would you have any other suggestions?
BO: Solo camping has become quite popular. It offers tranquility and self-reliance.
EK: Starting solo sounds good.
BO: Nervous about setting up a tent alone.
EK: Modern tents are easy to set up. Took me less than 5 minutes!
BO: That’s reassuring. I might try. Thank you.
EK: You're welcome! Enjoy your trip!
BO: Thanks for the info!

EK: Good evening.

BO: Good evening. How can I assist you?

EK: Have you had dinner?

BO: Yes, I have.

EK: What did you have?

BO: Dumplings.

EK: That sounds good. I haven’t eaten yet.

BO: Do you have plans for the evening?

EK: Now I want dumplings too.

BO: Dumplings are popular.

EK: I've been eating out a lot this summer. Are dumplings common at restaurants?

BO: Yes, they are.

EK: I like Osho. I went there two days ago.

BO: Osho is well-regarded. I often order the Tenshinhan and dumplings set.

EK: I like that set too. Does Tenshinhan taste different at various places?

BO: Yes, it can. I prefer the Tenshinhan at Osaka Ohsho.

EK: It’s very good there. Now I’m craving dumplings.

BO: Perhaps you can have some soon.

EK: Unfortunately, I don’t have any at home.

BO: That’s unfortunate.

EK: Is it okay to eat late at night?

BO: If I'm very hungry, I will. Otherwise, I wait until morning.

EK: Some people say not to eat after 6 PM, but that’s hard.

BO: It can be. I usually get home around 8 PM.

EK: True, sometimes it's even later and still fine.

BO: Yes, but I try not to overeat late at night.

EK: That’s good advice. I’ll remember that.

BO: Try to eat until you're about 80% full.

EK: I’ll wait tonight and go to Osho tomorrow.

BO: Good plan. Thank you for the conversation.

EK: Good morning!  
BT: Hello. Good morning.  
EK: Summer is almost over. Did you go anywhere this summer?  
BT: Actually, I haven't done much. I've been watching streams.  
EK: I see. Do you not go out often?  
BT: Yes. I usually stay indoors. I don't mind staying home all the time.  
EK: I see. Are you fine even if you don't go out much?  
BT: I do go shopping and visit museums every few months.  
EK: Is it an art museum? Like paintings?  
BT: Yes, I like paintings and sculptures.  
EK: That's interesting! I went to a museum recently, but I didn't know how to appreciate the art.  
BT: A book I read suggested carefully observing everything.  
EK: Is it okay if I interpret it as I like?  
BT: Yes, it's fine to decide based on your preferences and discuss your thoughts with the person you went with.  
EK: Is that okay with you? Do you also draw?  
BT: I do some design work, but it's not traditional painting.  
EK: That's impressive! Are you a professional?  
BT: No, it's nothing special. It's embarrassing.  
EK: Is everything digital nowadays?  
BT: I work digitally, doing coloring for CG.  
EK: That sounds complex.  
BT: By the way, what did you see at the museum?  
EK: I'm not sure what I saw. I remember Van Gogh and Monet.  
BT: That's amazing. Is the person you went with a fan of paintings?  
EK: I love my partner! I also draw, so I look at those.  
BT: Wow. Your partner seems knowledgeable.  
EK: No, I'm just figuring it out. But drawing is wonderful.  
BT: I see. People who draw often undervalue themselves because they're surrounded by other artists.  
EK: Certainly! It can be hard to know the right answer.  
BT: Make sure to tell your partner how amazing they are! Hehe.

EK: Hello!  
BT: Hello. How can I assist you today?  
EK: When it’s this hot, don’t you crave something cold?  
BT: Yes, I understand. I'm currently drinking peach-flavored juice.  
EK: It looks delicious! Do you always have it on hand?  
BT: No, I found it at a convenience store and decided to try it. It's a 1-liter pack.  
EK: Cold juice is nice too!  
BT: What kind of drinks do you prefer?  
EK: I only drink carbonated water!  
BT: I see. Do you drink only carbonated water?  
EK: Almost! Sometimes when I feel like drinking juice, I mix orange juice with soda water and drink it!  
BT: Is that for health reasons, or do you simply prefer sparkling water?  
EK: I like carbonated water. As a result, it's also healthy!  
BT: Understood. Are you using a home machine for carbonation, or do you purchase them?  
EK: I am currently buying them one by one! I drink about two 1.5-liter bottles a day.  
BT: That's quite a lot.  
EK: There are empty plastic bottles everywhere. When it comes to cold things, it's ice cream, right? Do you eat it often?  
BT: I don't eat ice cream very much. Maybe once or twice a month.  
EK: I see. I always keep Azuki bars on hand.  
BT: Aren't those quite hard?  
EK: Oh, you know about it! That's right! I like it!  
BT: You enjoy the hardness, don't you?  
EK: Yes, I do!  
BT: I prefer soft serve ice cream myself.  
EK: Sure, that's right. I'm sorry.  
BT: No need to apologize. Just making an observation.  
EK: It's early in the morning, but I'm starting to feel like eating.  
BT: Are you someone who can eat ice cream even for breakfast?  
EK: Yes, I can enjoy it as a pre-breakfast dessert!  
BT: Your love for Azuki bars is impressive.
